meanings.definition: A person or thing that plumps.
meanings.sent1: The little girl's cheeks were rosy and full, making her one of the cutest plumpers in the family.
meanings.sent2: The baker added extra yeast to the dough to make the bread rise and become plumpers.
meanings.sent3: The fluffy squirrel with its chubby cheeks looked like the happiest plumpers in the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, filling it with joy like a choir of plumpers.
meanings.sent5: The garden was filled with plumpers of all shapes and sizes, from round pumpkins to juicy tomatoes.

meanings.definition: A device used to plump or fill out something.
meanings.sent1: The cushion insert acted as a plumpers, giving the sofa a more comfortable feel.
meanings.sent2: She used a plumpers to inflate the air mattress for the camping trip.
meanings.sent3: The plumpers for the pillow made it so fluffy that it felt like sleeping on a cloud.
meanings.sent4: The plumber used a special plumpers to unclog the drain in no time.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a plumpers to shape the clay into a perfect sphere for the sculpture.

meanings.definition: A type of dental appliance used to fill out the cheeks.
meanings.sent1: The dentist recommended wearing the plumpers at night to help with jaw alignment.
meanings.sent2: After the accident, she had to wear plumpers to support her injured cheekbone.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that wearing plumpers made him look like a chipmunk storing nuts for winter.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was so wide that it seemed like she had forgotten to take out her plumpers.
meanings.sent5: The actress had to practice speaking with the plumpers to get used to the new sensation in her mouth.
